page.title: 13Kimbolton - Memories
page.content: A number of inhabitants were born here in the early 1900's and look back,past the two World Wars,to a childhood that seems glowing,isolated and cheerful.It was possible to walk around the parish far more freely,along paths that led through predominantly pasture land,to the Fishpond beyond Warren Hill,for instance,to bathe or to picnic.The emotion is sharper than simple nostalgia:mention is made of gaslight and candles,fleas,earth-closets and water carried from distant pumps,but most old people would have no difficulty choosing the hardships of their childhood ahead of the facilities of today as a preferable life-style.It would seem that their forebears{"knew the now lost secret of {being happy on little"}to quote Flora Thompson.
